name: InterContinental Milwaukee

reviews.text: Stayed one night. There were 2 TVs in the room. The semi-separate lounge area with TV is nice. Room & bathroom slightly dated, but pretty clean. The bed was comfortable. Blackout curtains worked well.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: The rooms in the Intercontinental are very nice, modern, comfortable, and updated. The whole hotel screams cool and fashionable without the high price either. Very good restaurant, cool bar, and the staff are very friendly and helpful too.
reviews.title: Intercontinental Milwaukee is a great place to stay

reviews.text: I came to clea after work on a Friday. Mind you...I'm from Chicago so I have to ease up on my measuring stick as most places pale in comparison to what I would find in the Chi on a Friday afternoon. Service was good, bartender s seemed knowledgeable as they got my Martini right. Music was pretty good as I heard some old school jams like "ring my bell" and "strawberry letter 22." But I felt this place was dead in a way. Again...I'm from Chicago so really this place is probably jumping for Milwaukee. All in all, it was good and if I wanted to stop here afterwork again I would.
reviews.title: Just a review of Clear in the Hotel

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel for a night while visiting Milwaukee. I must say that I was impressed with the common areas (lobby, bar, hallways) of the hotel--very stylish and modern. The art gallery inside is quite nice. The rooms, however, were far more plain and "standard" than the rest of the hotel would suggest. My particular room looked quite empty, with very little on the walls. The rooms also lacked minor things like a refrigerator / mini-bar and power outlets near the bed (things that have become standard in newer properties).
reviews.title: Excellent common areas; rooms unremarkable

reviews.text: Recently stayed for 2 nights as I had business near the hotel. I do not have enough good things to say about the InterContinental. Its an old hotel but once you step inside, you know it is special. The people, the service, the space and professionalism make this the place to stay in Milwaukee. They thought of everything, small and large: big rooms, many plugs you can access, knowledgeable staff and friendly, and the list goes on. You are made to feel special.I don't think you can beat it. I travel a lot and the InterContinental is right at the top.
reviews.title: What a great hotel!

reviews.text: I had pre booked and paid for a room at a competitive price. I arrived at 9pm and checked out the following morning at 8am. The location is prime - a short cab ride or drive to all-things Milwaukee. I was offered an upgraded room (top floor suite) for an additional $40 - I took it. The room was large with an excellent view and a stellar bathroom, complete with spa shower. Staff was friendly, the room was clean and I had no issues. I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Stay was short, but sweet
Great Location and Staff
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a wedding at Old St. Mary's Church so the location was perfect!! We had an elderly friend in a scooter and I cannot say enough about the friendly bell men who helped us unload, get all of us to our rooms, and continued to smile each time we came through the door. They even asked us how each part of the day went. I found all the staff to be extremely friendly and very professional!! A previous reviewer thought the rooms were too plain but I didn't find that at all. The restaurant for breakfast was pleasant with a great manager who was constantly moving around checking on things. I would definitely stay here again!

Visited the InterContinental Milwaukee in October 2012 for a conference. The hotel was the location for the 2012 Intermedix User Conference. The classrooms were easy to get to, and the hotel was very classy. The front desk staff were very friendly and willing to offer assistance day or night.
reviews.title: Very Classy. Great for Conferences.

reviews.text: The hotel is within walking distance of many attractions in downtown. My co-workers and I enjoyed the conference and our stay.
reviews.title: Good service

reviews.text: Catharina and the entire staff was great. sent me special food gifts to my room on my birthday .
reviews.title: Best in Milwaukee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the IC in downtown Milwaukee, and we have loved it both times. The entire staff is always welcoming with a great sense of humor. This trip we were celebrating our anniversary, and upon arrival back to our room the first night we were greated with a chilled bottle of wine, a box of delicious chocolates, and a hand-written congrats note from the concierge. What an unexpected and classy thing to do! Another great part of this hotel is the room service. Usually a hotel like this is really pricey and the food is only average, but not the IC Milwaukee. The breakfast was especially delicious, with generous amounts of food, all the condiments, and quick service. The price of each meal was no more than the same dinner would be out at a local restaurant. The rooms are a nice size with awesome modern furniture, and they are always super clean and organized. Special shout-outs to the reception staff, bell-hops, concierge staff, room service staff, and the bartenders. What an awesome anniversary weekend!
reviews.title: Fantastic downtown hotel with great staff and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very classy hotel in a very convenient Downtown area with everything in pristine condition. Nice sized rooms. coffee ,cookies and cold drinks available in reception.The hotel also had good parking facilities for a downtown hotel.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel

reviews.text: Easy access from airport. Great location downtown. Nice, large, comfortable room with good bed. Fruit basket and water in room on arrival. Well-equipped fitness center and business center to print last minute materials. Tasty room service breakfast that came super fast. What's not to like?
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Second time I have stayed here and you can't get better quality for the price. Open rooms that are not too big. Clean and modern. Front desk and valets were friendly. Good location for walking most places. Will stay here again next time.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel,with,very comfortable beds.Service from the front desk was great! We enjoyed dinner at "Killowat",the hotel restaurant.My wife raved about the lamb shank. It was very large,and,came with delicious mashed potatoes,and,gravy. I had pan fried chicken . It was awesome. Crispy skin,and,moist insiide.
reviews.title: great place in Brew city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We shared a large cesar salad. It was different,and,quite average.I had mushroom soup which was delicious. For desert,we shared a small lemon pudding tart with mint oil.That was very good. ..We will return to this very nice hotel.Excellent location in downtown Milwaukee..
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in good location

reviews.text: We enjoyed our one-night stay for a downtown wedding. We got a room on the 10th floor--very nice view. 'appreciated that Wi-Fi is complimentary. They did have punch and treats at check-in--nice. The restaurant in the hotel had a very good breakfast--reasonable and a good selection.
reviews.title: Great Service!

reviews.text: We were a bit displeased with the housekeeping aspect of our room, but pleasantly surprised and in fact, delighted with the front desk treatment of our issue. Mina, at the front desk went out of her way to make us comfortable. I have never been treated so well at a hotel. I highly recommend the Intercontinental Milwaukee based on the fantastic service of the employees at the front desk. Thank you for making our visit to Milwaukee so much more enjoyable!
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Better Staff.

reviews.text: Stayed a week at InterContinental. Hotel is located around some nice eaterys. Saff was super nice. My man Paul at the front desk was extremely helpful. Few Milwaukee Bucks rookies was there and talk about arrogant and cocky. GEEEESH. Paul went above and beyond to help me handle my business, but most of all made sure my stay was on point. Although Valet is a little pricey at $32 per night, the Valet team (Brandon and Big Red) had my car waiting everyday for me at 7:30 am. Overall the Hotel is clean, the team is super awesome and some good bar food. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Boutique feel.

description: InterContinental Milwaukee is the place to indulge your senses. Located along the Milwaukee Riverwalk, a vibrant stretch lined with parks, sculptures, restaurants and nightlife, the InterContinental Milwaukee places you in the centre of the downtown business and theatre districts. Discover the historic Pabst Theatre, the Milwaukee Art and Natural History Museums, or one of Milwaukee's many summer festivals. For a more leisurely tour of the city take a walk along Old World Third Street or in Cathedral Square Park, and don't forget to visit the Milwaukee Public Market.
